instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Ok, so there was charred points on two inside points of charger input of DCIN board. I replaced DCIN, hooking mac charger up shuts the charger off. I have a short on PPBUS_G3H somewhere. Wasn't sure the best way to find the short without potentially blowing something important up like CPU or smc...

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Compare that short, in ohm scale, with the readings on the big coils...

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: short is .001 ohms and I get that reading at L7130

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
L7130 is on PPBUS_G3H rail.
I was referring to other big coils, from secondary power supplies...

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: L7310/20/30 are all at 24.5 ohms... those are the coils reading closest I can find to .001 ohms

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Looks to be happy case, you can inject voltage on PPBUS_G3H.
Start with 1V, maybe no need to reach 3V even.
Be sure to use a powerfull lab PSU; at least 10A limit.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: is it possible the short is in l7130? that is the only thing getting warm on board

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Lift one side of the board and see where the short remains.
Inject voltage on that point.
If you discard 100% any shorted high-side MOSFET, you can inject higher voltage.
But with such low value, 3-5V should overheat something.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: q7135... I think I'll have to order one... I don't think I have one on a different board

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: oh guess I do have one on a 820-2915

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Things are working better. two issues. Blinking orange light on charger when battery is plugged in. Computer boots well but no backlight. Checked with external display to verify it boots to login. 

I apparently have a short related to display connector as I get a short from pin 1 to ground diode j8300 when display is plugged in but I really find it hard to believe its the screen... I don't have another to test with. This was liquid damaged in area of j8300 and customer shorted plug dcin trying other chargers to see if it would turn on.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
"I get a short from pin 1 to ground diode j8300 when display is plugged in but I really find it hard to believe its the screen"
I know people believing in god even without any reason; you have a powerfull one, at least...

Video cable, or display.
The short may also appear inside connector, only when the cable is inserted; change connector, if is the case.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Man. you were right... I was able to test on another display and short is in the display. Customer is willing to pay for new display for this. Unbelievable. $$$

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Still have a charging issue. This boots fine. Runs off battery or MS2 but battery doesn't charge. I was getting a blinking orange light but replaced q7130. Orange light now stays on and sometimes display shows charging, sometimes it doesn't but battery status appearance doesn't change whether the MagSafe is plugged in or not and the percentage battery only goes down. I checked the resistors are correct readings at r7102 (missing and I believe this is normal? but resistance between those points is 75k), r7100 is 0 ohms & r7112 is just under 1k. Resistance between pins 17/18 is 2.9 ohms and 27/28 is 22 ohms

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
R7102 is not mounted; NO STUFF, as per schematic.

Exact PPBUS_G3H voltage w/ and w/o battery?
Did you try known good battery?

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: So... apparently now it is not operating off of Magsafe only. not sure when that changed. I only have 1.5V slowly drops toward 0 on ppbus_g3h without battery plugged in. with battery ppbus_g3h is 11.1V

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
You must fix PPBUS_G3H problem first, on charger only.
PPDCIN_G3H and 3V42_G3H stable?

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
PPDCIN_G3H is steady at16.54V
3V42_G3H does hold at 3.42V
I replaced q7130 again as diode test showed no connection no matter how I tried to read point to point. That now looks better but I still don't have fan spin on charger only... PPBUS_G3H is now 1.7V and slowly rising since changing q7130 again.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Do not expect fan spin with 1.7V at PPBUS_G3H.

Post basic voltages for ISL6259; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
"2-2.7V"
First check diode mode to ground.
If OK, change R/D7105; maybe only one bad...

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: ppbus_g3h is now 3.17V

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
"3-.477V"
Do you mean 0.477V???
If yes, fix the problem.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Replaced ISL and now get 3.9V at pin 3. PPBUS_g3H is now 12.6-13.6V not stable.
Still no fan spin on charger only.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H must be steady 12.6V, without battery connected.
3V42_G3H is stable?
Do you get 3V3_S5?
Be sure to use original 60/85W  Magsafe 2 charger; check PM_BATLOW_L.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
See responses below...

3V42_G3H is stable? yes 3.43V

Do you get 3V3_S5? yes, steady 3.35V

Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger; 

yes using original 85w charger

check PM_BATLOW_L. = 3.34V

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H must be steady 12.6V, without battery connected."
Any mention about this???

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: there has been no change in PPBUs_g3H without battery, it is still fluctuating 12.6V to 13.6V

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
That's no good.
Remove F7140/41 and check C7140 voltage; keep battery disconnected.
Resolder U7100 and surrounding components.

threads.title: 820-3662 charred points on dcin board short on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
resoldering u7100 did it. Found out the short to display was actually the connector so it killed the display and a chunk or short was in the connector also so this was a big job for me as I'm new to this but I successfully put a new lvds on the board and it is ready for pickup for the customer.

Thanks for your help!
